meanings.definition: Of an extent, amount, or intensity considerably above the normal or average.
meanings.sent1: The elephant was so great that it could not fit through the tiny door.
meanings.sent2: The mountain was great, towering over the entire valley.
meanings.sent3: It was a great surprise to see a tiny mouse lift a heavy rock.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness was a great beacon in a world of darkness.
meanings.sent5: The storm brought great destruction to the small town.

meanings.definition: Of ability, quality, or eminence considerably above the normal or average.
meanings.sent1: She was a great artist, painting beautiful pictures that amazed everyone.
meanings.sent2: The great chef prepared a delicious meal that left everyone satisfied.
meanings.sent3: The cat's great intelligence was evident when it solved the puzzle.
meanings.sent4: His great leadership skills guided the team to victory.
meanings.sent5: The great singer's voice filled the entire hall with joy.

meanings.definition: Used to express surprise, admiration, or contempt.
meanings.sent1: Great! I forgot my lunch at home again.
meanings.sent2: Oh great, now it's raining and I forgot my umbrella.
meanings.sent3: Great! The cat knocked over the vase again.
meanings.sent4: Great, just what I needed - a flat tire on my way to work.
meanings.sent5: Great! The power went out in the middle of my favorite show.
